description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Alanya's Embrace" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Alanya's Embrace

places.generalDescription: The Red Tower, also known as Kizilkule, is an iconic 13th-century octagonal tower located in the city of Alanya. It was commissioned by the Seljuk Sultan Alaeddin Keykubad and constructed by architect Abu Ali Reha el Kettani. The upper parts of the tower are made of baked red bricks, giving it its distinctive name.

sources.snippet: Where to stay: I stayed at the Diamond Hill Resort & Spa, which was a surprisingly affordable 5* star hotel just 4 kilometeres from the city center. It was all-inclusive, meaning we saved lots of money on dining in. The service and amenities were not quite 5*, but I think this is to be expected.
sources.shortName: 19 Amazing Things to do in Alanya, T√ºrkiye
Honeymoon In Alanya Turkey
20 Top Things to do in Alanya Turkey (With Prices & Video)
The 16 best things to see & do in Alanya

places.name: Red Tower

reviews.text:
Standing at the Red Tower in Alanya, gazing out over the deep blue sea, I felt as if I had stepped back in time to the Middle Ages. The gentle sound of waves crashing against the shore and the serene view under the clear sky created a sense of timeless tranquility. The tower's red bricks and its ancient, steadfast presence pulled me into a different era, leaving me with a blend of emotions that were both nostalgic and reflective.

As I looked at the medieval fortress, I couldn't help but wonder about the people who once stood in the same spot, taking in the very same sea. What did this view mean to them? Did they dream of the unknown world beyond the horizon, or was it merely a backdrop to their daily lives? While the sea represented freedom and calmness to me, for them, it might have been a stage for survival, a gateway to trade, or a boundary against threats.

The pleasant weather made my walk even more enjoyable. With the warm sunlight on my skin and a gentle sea breeze brushing past, I wandered along the path, savoring the blend of past and present. Amidst the modern buildings, the Red Tower stood as a portal to history, allowing me to momentarily step into the shoes of those who lived centuries before. For a brief moment, I felt less like a tourist and more like a character in a living story, where history whispered through the stones.

Ultimately, what I felt at the Red Tower was a profound sense of connection. It was a link between past and present, between myself and countless souls who had also gazed at this sea. Perhaps they, too, had felt the same breeze, stood against the same horizon, and pondered their place in the world. My experience at the Red Tower was more than just a travel memory-it was a resonant moment that left a lasting imprint on my story, blending the ancient with the present in a way that felt both humbling and inspiring.
Great historical place. Couldn't go in as it closed as I arrived, but a fascinating history and satisfying walk round the shipyards which are not far away and very cheap for entry.

the red tower (kƒ±zƒ±lkule) is definitely a must-visit spot. the sea below is very clean, the view is stunning, and the tower itself tells a rich historical story - it's truly wonderful. i highly recommend exploring both the inside and outside of the castle, as every part has something unique to offer.

for me, this place will always remain a part of my childhood, and i deeply love it. it gives me an incredible sense of peace and connection. the view of the ships and boats during sunset is absolutely breathtaking.

at the upper parts of the castle, you can also find different restaurants and tourist spots where you can take a break, enjoy the scenery, and fully experience the magical atmosphere of this historic landmark.

places.generalDescription: Alanya Castle, a historic fortress dating back to the Hellenistic Period, stands as an iconic symbol in Alanya. Originally built for defense and control of the harbor, it attracted Mediterranean pirates before being expanded and enhanced by the Roman Empire and later the Seljuk Empire. The castle is divided into three parts: Outer Castle, Middle Castle, and Inner Castle.

sources.snippet: When it comes to places to visit in Alanya, Alanya Castle is undoubtedly the one that comes to mind first. With a total of 83 towers and approximately 1200 cisterns, Alanya Castle is a magnificent structure dating back to the Hellenistic period. We recommend that you spend one day of your Alanya tour to visit Alanya Castle and the local artisans selling traditional clothes and handmade rugs.
sources.shortName: What to See in Alanya Turkey

sources.snippet: Where to stay: I stayed at the Diamond Hill Resort & Spa, which was a surprisingly affordable 5* star hotel just 4 kilometeres from the city center. It was all-inclusive, meaning we saved lots of money on dining in. The service and amenities were not quite 5*, but I think this is to be expected.
sources.shortName: 19 Amazing Things to do in Alanya, T√ºrkiye

sources.snippet: Back in the Alexander the Great days, there were pirates all over this water, and they took refuge in the castle. The walls wrap around the edge of the city from the sea up to the top of the hill. At night, they light up and it‚Äôs a really beautiful scene.
sources.shortName: 20 Top Things to do in Alanya Turkey (With Prices & Video)

sources.snippet: I went on this one: Alanya Castle and Cave Tour with lunch and boat trip. Especially suitable for families with children!. I stayed at the TUI BLUE Pascha Bay family hotel a few kilometres from Alanya.
sources.shortName: The 16 best things to see & do in Alanya

sources.snippet: I really love to come here by cable car (32 liras/approx. 3 euros one-way and 39 liras/approx. 4 euros round-trip) and just wander around, observing the splendid views from different angles.
sources.shortName: Eight Things You Should Not Do in Alanya, Turkey
Honeymoon In Alanya Turkey

places.name: Alanya Castle

reviews.text:
Alanya is a coastal holiday resort on the Turkish Mediterranean coast, east of the city of Antalya. Jutting out from the harbour is a rocky peninsula and the castle sits over 800 feet high at the top. Although most of the building dates back to the 13th century its origins go back to Roman times. The surrounding walls are over 4 miles around and there are many ruins around the Castle and Citadel. Since 2009 it has been a World Heritage Site.

From the harbour the road rises sharply. The Castle is well signed and the roads easy to follow. It's about a two mile climb and is very steep in places. However, if your lungs or legs are not up to it there are lots of taxis, a shuttle bus and even a cable car. Every hairpin bends brings new views with sections of the walls crossing over. Just before the summit there is a Viewpoint that gives an amazing view out over the bay and town. Don't miss that one.

At the top there are narrow streets weaving between the mosque, the old bazaar and the citadel. There are also many authentic tiny restaurants too.
The Castle is now a museum and has an entrance charge of ‚Ç¨12.

No particular special kit needed for this, other than comfortable shoes.
It is important, however, to remember this is a hot climate, a 'modest' 22¬∞ for my visit in April. It can reach much hotter so the order of the day is lots of sun cream and lots and of water.

The castle has a great view of the city so you may only go there to see this fantastic view. We liked walking up to the entrance and they have clean toilets and a shop selling fresh cold drinks. It was not too busy maybe because we went there during the week. The whole place could be a bit cleaner but still good.

Get on the cable car to the top to see some spectacular views. The castle is big and you could easily spend a whole day there exploring. You will need some decent footwear as there are many steps. Walkways are full of little bazaar type shops and hidden gems to explore. Visited with a guide to show us the best bits buy can easily make your own way around. The sunset was awesome.

places.address: Hisari√ßi, Erken Sk. No:12, 07400 Alanya/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Alanya, Turkey, Damlatas Cave is a renowned natural wonder discovered in 1948. The cave's unique air composition, with high levels of carbon dioxide and 95% humidity, has made it a popular destination for asthma patients seeking relief. Visitors can combine a trip to the cave with nearby attractions such as Kleopatra Beach, the Cable Car, and Kalesi Fortress for a full day of exploration.

sources.snippet: Damlata≈ü cave, Turkey's first cave opened to tourism, was discovered in 1948. It is a true natural wonder with its passages of more than 50 meters, millions of years old stalactites, stalagmites and dripstone pools. We highly recommend you to witness this magical atmosphere that will transport you to different worlds from the first moment you enter.
sources.shortName: What to See in Alanya Turkey

sources.snippet: The two main beaches of the city are Kleopatra Beach and Halk beach, on either side of the hill that houses the castle. There are areas of both beaches that have been given different names, such as Damlatas Beach on the far end of Kleopatra beach (but the cave), and Oba beach to the East of Halk beach.
sources.shortName: 19 Amazing Things to do in Alanya, T√ºrkiye
Honeymoon In Alanya Turkey
20 Top Things to do in Alanya Turkey (With Prices & Video)
The 16 best things to see & do in Alanya

places.name: Damlata≈ü Cave

reviews.text:
Damlata≈ü Cave is a really fascinating place to visit and a nice little escape from the heat! As soon as you step inside, you feel the cool, fresh air and see the incredible stalactites and stalagmites that have formed over thousands of years, it's truly amazing to look at.
The cave is not very big, but it's well worth seeing, especially if you're interested in nature and geology. The atmosphere inside is calm and quiet, and it's easy to walk around at your own pace and take it all in.
It's also really close to the beach, so it's easy to fit into your day if you're already in the area. The small entrance fee is worth it for such a unique experience. I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Alanya - a little hidden gem that's definitely worth a stop!

Nice activity if you like caves, stalactites and stalagmites. Very reasonably priced at 300TL for two adults (children go free). Only 3 stars as it's a lot smaller than expected. You go in, down some stairs into a recess where there are lots of stalactites and stalagmites.
The cave has ancient healing properties according to legend.
A nice place to escape the heat of the day.

Damlata≈ü Cave is a small and simple place, but it is truly beautiful and worth a visit. The natural formations inside are fascinating, and even though the cave is not very large, it has a unique charm that makes the experience special.

The ticket price is very reasonable, and I really appreciated that they offer a student discount for those studying in T√ºrkiye, which makes it even more affordable. The staff at the entrance were polite, helpful, and welcoming, which made the visit more pleasant.

It doesn't take too long to explore the cave, but it's a nice stop, especially if you are already visiting the nearby Cleopatra Beach. The atmosphere inside is cool and peaceful, making it a great way to escape the heat for a while.

Overall, a simple but beautiful natural attraction with kind workers and fair prices. Definitely recommended if you're in Alanya.

places.generalDescription: Experience the breathtaking Alanya Teleferik, a cable car service that offers stunning views of the city and its surroundings. The ride takes you from Damlatas Beach to the lower castle district of Ehmedek, passing by Kleopatra beach and Alanya castle. With gondolas departing every 19 seconds, you'll ascend 250 meters on a 900-meter line, treating you to astonishing 360-degree views over the Gulf of Antalya and the Taurus Mountains.

sources.snippet: Set out on a 2-hour romantic tour in Alanya, featuring free cancellation, a live English and Turkish guide, and the flexibility to reserve now and pay later.
sources.shortName: Alanya: Guided Romantic Tour
The 16 best things to see & do in Alanya

places.name: ALANYA TELEFERƒ∞K A.≈û.

reviews.text: The views speak for themselves going on the cable kart however one little gem is going before the season starts fully April/May I was able to get my own cabin and I waited a grand total of 6 minutes or less for the cable kart to come round. It's actually really smooth and there's fresh air coming in through the windows. The walk up all the steps to the castle is also very nice but the heat of the sun and the incline means you are putting in an extra 30% effort. All the staff were very friendly and the roof top restaurant or bar was not as expensive as you would think

20/04/25 I really enjoyed this. It was a lovely view of the surrounding area and very picturesque at sunset. I would recommend giving yourself plenty of time as there is much to see up the top, and if you like exploring, there are interesting areas off the beaten track and a restaurant with amazing views and music. If you are with a stroller or wheelchair bound, I wouldn't recommend. I'm giving it a 4 star as the website is misleading and only states the price for turkish nationals, this is such basic information I can only assume this is intentional misdirection. We paid 450 TL per person on the stated date.
Three adults' admission to the attraction costs 1500 lira, making it an exceptionally affordable option. The scenic views are also highly captivating

places.address: Saray, G√ºzelyalƒ± Cd. No:7, 07400 Alanya/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Damlata≈ü Beach is one of the well-known beaches in Alanya, offering a serene atmosphere and featuring a beautiful cave. Situated in front of the Damlata≈ü cave, this sandy beach provides crystal clear waters and stunning views of the green mountain with the Alanya castle. However, it's important to be cautious when entering the sea due to its rocky and slippery entrance.

sources.snippet: Couple hugging on background beach ocean sunrise meeting of lovers concept silhouette two romantic people cuddling and looking on view evening seascape hipster enjoy sunset together travel holidays vacation relax
sources.shortName: Romantic Places Banco de Imagens para seus Projetos Criativos

places.name: Damlata≈ü Beach

reviews.text: This is one of the best beaches in the city. It has fine sand, not pebbles. Also, thanks to the mountain, there is very beautiful emerald water. There is a cable car next to the beach. They say that in high season there is an entrance fee, but in December we walked freely.

Damlata≈ü Beach, located in the heart of Alanya on Turkey's stunning Mediterranean coast, is a place where natural beauty and history converge. Known for its crystal-clear turquoise waters and golden sands, the beach offers a serene retreat for sunbathers and swimmers alike. What makes Damlata≈ü truly unique, however, is its proximity to the famous Damlata≈ü Cave, discovered in 1948. The cave, renowned for its healing properties due to its high humidity and constant temperature, adds a mystical allure to the beach's charm. Visitors can explore the cave's stunning stalactites and stalagmites before stepping out to relax on the tranquil shores. Framed by the majestic Taurus Mountains and overlooked by Alanya's historic fortress, Damlata≈ü Beach combines the best of nature, history, and local culture, making it an unforgettable destination for tourists seeking both relaxation and exploration.

No one protects the purity of the water. Yachts and ships dump waste. Dangerous waste floats in the sea, including sewage from human waste on yachts, posing a risk of intestinal infection-do not swallow the water.

places.generalDescription: Kleopatra Beach, located at the western foot of a promontory in Alanya, offers a long stretch of coarse sand and gentle surf. The beach widens as you head north, providing uninterrupted views of the castle and Taurus Mountains. Along the shore, there are beach clubs with sun loungers and a wide promenade lined with palm trees. Visitors can access the castle via a steep cobblestone road or take the Alanya Teleferik from Kleopatra Beach.

sources.snippet: There are options in Alanya for those who want an active holiday on crowded beaches & beach parties and for those who want to relax in untouched bays. Moreover, there are many blue flag beaches in Alanya and the sea season lasts from April to November.
sources.shortName: What to See in Alanya Turkey

sources.snippet: If you ask anyone who has vacationed in Alanya where the best beach is, the answer will most likely be Kleopatra Beach.
sources.shortName: Eight Things You Should Not Do in Alanya, Turkey
The 16 best things to see & do in Alanya

places.name: Kleopatra Beach

reviews.text: The beach itself is amazing,very long and plenty of space for everyone. The sea there is beautiful, lifeguards are everywhere so it seems to be like a safe place to swim. Negative is no free toilet these days Paying 50p for every entry is just stealing money for your basic needs.

This is a beautiful huge beach. It really reminds me of Thailand üòç. The sand is golden and the water was a nice colour in the winter - it must be stunning in the summer. This beach is 100% worth a visit when you're in or around Alanya.

The beach itself is very beautiful and convenient. However, it's very dirty. I don't understand why neither the beach nor the water is cleaned. The water is very polluted by visitors, with microplastics, bandages, and various waste that shouldn't be there visible everywhere. The authorities and visitors show a very careless attitude toward such a beautiful place. It's really a shame.

places.generalDescription: Kleopatra Havuzu Lake is a stunning destination that attracts numerous tourists, drawn by its mineral-rich waters believed to enhance beauty. The surrounding travertines are breathtaking, although they can get quite crowded. Nearby, the ancient city of Hierapolis offers a glimpse into history with its impressive artifacts and scenic views. For those seeking relaxation, the area boasts a long sandy beach where visitors can enjoy warm waters and picturesque sunsets during June and July.

sources.shortName: Romantic Places Banco de Imagens para seus Projetos Criativos

places.name: Kleopatra Havuzu Lake

reviews.text: Nice views
Everything we visit Turkey we end ip on these trips. I do enjoy the swim off shore with the kids. Watching the guys jumping off the cliffs, great entertainment for 3/4 hours
Good views!

places.generalDescription: If you're planning a trip to Turkey and need a reliable car rental service, look no further than MOUNTAIN RENT A CAR. This company is renowned for its exceptional customer service, where friendly and helpful staff go above and beyond to ensure your experience is seamless from start to finish. The cars are delivered in pristine condition, allowing you to hit the road with confidence.

I drove a total of 1744 km from Alanya-Cappadocia-Gaziantep-Gblekli-Tepe-Mersin-Alanya.
The car was extraordinary, diesel DSG7.
Thank you very much for your help.
